sentences.english: I had an alb on and a long robe with long sleeves.
sentences.chinese: 我穿着白袍，一件帶長袖的長袍。

sentences.english: She began unfastening the collar of her gown.
sentences.chinese: 她動手解她長袍的領子。

sentences.english: “They imagined we were dressing up in robes and chanting,” he says.
sentences.chinese: “他們想象我們穿着長袍在唸咒，”他說。

sentences.english: Tesla was up now and dusting off his robes.
sentences.chinese: 泰斯拉現在站了起來，正拍去他長袍上的灰塵。

sentences.english: Decked out in old -fashioned white gowns, they still look sensational.
sentences.chinese: 穿上舊式的白色長袍，她們看起來仍然不同凡響。

sentences.english: Heavy embroidery was used, and robes often including brocade and elaborate stoles.
sentences.chinese: 刺繡是重使用，披肩長袍往往包括博科和闡述。

sentences.english: She wore a murrey-coloured gown with a little lace collar .
sentences.chinese: 她穿了一件帶花邊小領子的黑紫色長袍。

sentences.english: Did you order your cap and gown?
sentences.chinese: 你訂方頂帽和長袍了嗎？

sentences.english: A gown made of the finest wool.
sentences.chinese: 用最細的羊毛織一條長袍。

sentences.english: Red hair and a hand-me-down robe…you must be a Weasley.
sentences.chinese: 紅頭髮，舊長袍，你一定是衛斯理。

sentences.english: He wears traditional salwar kameez and a Rolex watch.
sentences.chinese: 他身着傳統的印度長袍，手上戴一塊勞力士錶。

sentences.english: The sun has him simple robe of light.
sentences.chinese: 太陽穿着素潔的光芒長袍。

sentences.english: Plush poly fleece robe envelops the body in softness and warmth.
sentences.chinese: 毛絨搖粒絨長袍籠罩了柔軟和溫暖的身體。

sentences.english: Marchers always wear a robe, holding a cross.
sentences.chinese: 遊行者身穿長袍，手持十字架，赤足前進。
她穿的寬鬆長袍刺繡精美。

sentences.english: A woman in a brown abaya, hijab and gloves proceeded forward.
sentences.chinese: 一個在一個棕色長袍，面紗和手套的女人進行着。

definition: cloth head covering worn by men in ancient times/headscarf (typically worn by women)/kerchief/turban
long gown/cheongsam/traditional Asian dress for men or (in Hong Kong) women's qipao
buttoned mandarin jacket of the Qing dynasty 清代[Qing1 dai4] (1644-1911)
crew neck/round neck (of pull-over garment, e.g. T-shirt)
